verses.text: Hey, this is Jude, a servant of Jesus and a sibling of James—sending a shoutout to all the people God has called and are keeping it real in faith.
May mercy, peace, and love get poured on you fully.
I was planning to write about the salvation we all share, but I felt I had to hit you with a warning instead: you’ve got to fight hard for the faith we were handed.
Some people snuck in uninvited—sneaky influencers in the wrong way. They twist God’s grace into an excuse for wild behavior and deny Jesus as their boss.
I want to remind you, even though you know it already: God saved His people from Egypt, but later those who didn’t believe got wiped out.
Also, angels who didn’t stick to their lane—God locked them up in eternal chains for judgment on the big day.
And Sodom and Gomorrah? Total chaos vibes—they went after sexual sins and perversion, and got annihilated as a warning.
These people are wild—they complain, argue, and follow their own shady desires. Their energy is all wrong.
Even Michael, the archangel, didn’t go off at Satan directly. He said, “God, back off!” instead of throwing shade on him himself.
But these people? They throw shade everywhere, spreading gossip, and they act without thinking—no filter.
Honestly, they’re like Cain (killed his brother out of jealousy), Balaam (cash-grabbing prophet), and Korah (rebellious leader)—total chaos squad energy.
These are the type who stir up drama at feasts, living it up while pretending to be spiritual. Clouds without rain, blown around by the wind.
Wild waves of the sea, foaming up their shame; wandering stars, doomed forever. Darkness is their final destination.
Enoch, the seventh from Adam, said something about God coming to judge: “Check this—God is coming with a ton of holy people to clap back on everyone.”
He’s ready to throw judgment on all and rebuke the ungodly for all the messed-up stuff they’ve done, including all the harsh words spoken against Him.
These people complain constantly, chase after what they want, and boast about empty stuff. They’re hyped up without reason.
But you, dear friends, remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus said—the OG messengers who told you the truth.
They warned you that in the last times, some sneaky people would show up, mocking and living off their own desires.
These people divide the squad, driven by their own selfishness, without the Spirit.
But you? Build yourselves up in your most solid faith, pray in the Spirit,
keep yourselves in God’s love, while waiting for Jesus to come through with mercy for eternal life.
Be kind to people who aren’t sure about their faith.
Pull back those who are messed up, but do it carefully—don’t get tangled in their mess, and keep hating the sin but loving the person.
Now to God, who can keep you from falling, and put you standing strong, blameless, and hyped in front of His glory—
to Him, our Savior, the one who can do it all, be glory, majesty, power, and authority before all time, now, and forever. Amen.
